intro: Vallota elata, commonly known as the tall vallota, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Vallota elata is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands.
